results.definition: a shape that is spherical and small
examples: he studied the shapes of low-viscosity drops

results.definition: remove (cargo, people, etc.) from and leave
examples: drop off the passengers at the hotel

results.definition: grow worse
fall or descend to a lower place or level
a sudden sharp decrease in some quantity
examples: a drop of 57 points on the Dow Jones index
there was a drop in pressure in the pulmonary artery

results.definition: a free and rapid descent by the force of gravity
examples: it was a miracle that he survived the drop from that height

results.definition: let or cause to fall in drops
stop associating with
examples: They dropped her after she had a child out of wedlock

results.definition: pay out
a small indefinite quantity (especially of a liquid)
examples: he had a drop too much to drink
a drop of each sample was analyzed
there is not a drop of pity in that man

results.definition: get rid of
cause to fall by or as if by delivering a blow
hang freely
examples: The light dropped from the ceiling

results.definition: a steep high face of rock
examples: a steep drop

results.definition: stop pursuing or acting
examples: drop a lawsuit

results.definition: leave undone or leave out
a curtain that can be lowered and raised onto a stage from the flies; often used as background scenery
lower the pitch of (musical notes)
a central depository where things can be left or picked up
a predetermined hiding place for the deposit and distribution of illicit goods (such as drugs or stolen property)
change from one level to another
examples: She dropped into army jargon

results.definition: fall or sink into a state of exhaustion or death
examples: shop til you drop

results.definition: give birth; used for animals
examples: The cow dropped her calf this morning

results.definition: go down in value
examples: Stock prices dropped

results.definition: let fall to the ground
examples: Don't drop the dishes

results.definition: lose (a game)
examples: The Giants dropped 11 of their first 13

results.definition: omit (a letter or syllable) in speaking or writing
examples: New Englanders drop their post-vocalic r's

results.definition: take (a drug, especially LSD), by mouth
examples: She dropped acid when she was a teenager

results.definition: terminate an association with
examples: drop him from the Republican ticket

results.definition: the act of dropping something
examples: they expected the drop would be successful

results.definition: to fall vertically
examples: the bombs are dropping on enemy targets

results.definition: utter with seeming casualness
examples: drop a hint
drop names
